value:
{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06946v1", "title": "Uniqueness of Lp Minkowski problem in the supercritical range", "summary": "The uniqueness of the $L_p$-Minkowski problem has been a long standing
problem in convex geometry. In the groundbreaking paper by
Brendle-Choi-Daskalopoulos (Acta Math, {\bf219}, 2017), a full uniqueness
result was shown for the subcritical exponents $p\in(-n-1,1]$. In the
supercritical range, the uniqueness problem is much more complicated, even in
the planar case $n=1$. One of the famous results was shown by Andrews (J. Amer.
Math. Soc., {\bf16}, 2003), where he established that the uniqueness holds in
the range $p\in(-7,-2)$ and fails to hold for the other supercritical exponents
$p\in(-\infty,-7)$. In this paper, we study the same uniqueness problem in the
full supercritical range $p\in(-2n-5,-n-1)$ for all higher dimensional cases
$n\geq2$. We will prove that for $p\in(-2n-5,-n-1)$, the unique strongly
symmetric solution is given by the unit sphere ${\mathbb{S}}^n$. The uniqueness
range $(-2n-5,-n-1)$ is optimal due to our recent preprint (arXiv: 2104.07426)
joint with J. Lu and Y.N. Liu, where we have constructed non-spherical strongly
symmetric solutions for all $p\in(-\infty,-2n-5)$. When considering general
solutions without symmetricity assumption, the uniqueness set $\Gamma$ of $p$
for which the uniqueness holds, is shown to be both relatively open and closed
in the full interval $(-2n-5,-n-1)$.", "main_category": "math.AP", "categories": "math.AP", "published": "2025-04-09T14:53:18Z"}
